wikipedia_page.main:
Stewart Rome (born Septimus William Ryott, 30 January 1886 – 26 February 1965) was an English actor who appeared in more than 150 films between 1913 and 1950.
He was born in Newbury, Berkshire in 1886 and took the stage name of Stewart Rome, which was later unsuccessfully contested by Cecil Hepworth, who also used the name. He became a major star in the silent era.

The Last Hour is a 1930 British comedy crime film directed by Walter Forde and starring Richard Cooper and Stewart Rome and Kathleen Vaughan. It is adapted from a successful play of the same title by Charles Bennett.

response: || Reveille || George Pearson || Betty Balfour, Stewart Rome, Ralph Forbes || Among the BFI 75 Most Wanted. At least some sequences are known to survive in private hands. ||

In 1916, the play was adapted into a silent film Trelawny of the Wells directed by Cecil Hepworth and starring Alma Taylor, Stewart Rome, and Violet Hopson. The play was adapted a second time in 1928 by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer as The Actress, directed by Sidney Franklin and starring Norma Shearer.  There was also a 1938 adaptation directed by Tyrone Guthrie.

The Girl in the Flat is a 1934 British crime film directed by Redd Davis and starring Stewart Rome, Belle Chrystall, Vera Bogetti and Noel Shannon.BFI.org Its plot concerns a barrister's fiancée who is blackmailed over an alleged murder.
* Stewart Rome - Sir John Waterton
Rynox is a 1932 British crime film directed by Michael Powell and starring Stewart Rome and John Longden.  Rynox was adapted from a 1930 novel by popular thriller writer of the day Philip MacDonald.
* Stewart Rome as Boswell Marsh/F.X. Benedik

Important People is a 1934 British comedy film directed by Adrian Brunel and starring Stewart Rome, Dorothy Boyd and Jack Raine.BFI.org In the film, a bickering couple stand against each other as candidates in a local council election.
* Stewart Rome as Tony Westcott
The Baby on the Barge is a 1915 British silent film drama directed by Cecil Hepworth and starring Alma Taylor and Stewart Rome.  No print of the film is known to survive and it is presumed lost.
* Stewart Rome as Bob Jennis
* Stewart Rome as Alfred Trevor

The Woman Who Obeyed is a 1923 British silent film directed by Sidney Morgan and starring Stewart Rome, Hilda Bayley, and Peter Dear.

Betrayal is a 1932 British crime film directed by Reginald Fogwell and starring Stewart Rome, Marjorie Hume and Leslie Perrins.BFI.org A woman attempts to save her husband from being hanged for a crime he didn't commit. It is based on a play No Crime of Passion by Hubert G. Griffith.
* Stewart Rome as John Armytage

Barnaby Rudge is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by Thomas Bentley and Cecil M. Hepworth and starring Tom Powers, Stewart Rome and Violet Hopson.BFI.org It was an adaptation of the 1841 novel Barnaby Rudge by Charles Dickens which was set amidst the 1780 Gordon Riots in London.
* Stewart Rome as Maypole Hugh
* Stewart Rome as Sir Valentine

Nets of Destiny is a 1924 British drama film directed by Arthur Rooke and starring Stewart Rome, Mary Odette and Gertrude McCoy. It was an adaptation of the novel The Salving of a Derelict by Maurice Drake. The screenplay concerns a son who tries to overturn the disgrace of his father, who committed suicide.
* Stewart Rome - Lawrence Averil

Somehow Good is a 1927 British silent drama film directed by Jack Raymond and starring Fay Compton, Stewart Rome and Dorothy Boyd. It was made at Twickenham Studios and premiered in October 1927.Low p.187
* Stewart Rome - Jerry Harrison
* Stewart Rome as Sir Ramsey Flight

Dicky Monteith is a 1922 British silent drama film directed by Kenelm Foss and starring Stewart Rome, Joan Morgan and Jack Minister.BFI.org Its plot involves a lawyer who tries to con a drunken client out of a large sum of money. It is an adaptation of a play by Tom Gallon and Leon M. Lion.
* Stewart Rome as Dicky Monteith

Deadlock is a 1931 British crime film directed by George King and starring Stewart Rome, Marjorie Hume and Warwick Ward. It is on the British Film Institute's list of the 75 Most Wanted list of lost films.
* Stewart Rome as James Whitelaw

The Eleventh Commandment is a 1924 British crime film directed by George A. Cooper and starring Fay Compton, Stewart Rome and Lillian Hall-Davis.BFI.org It is based on the play The Eleventh Commandment by Brandon Fleming.
* Stewart Rome as John Lynton

Shadowed Eyes is a 1940 British crime film directed by Maclean Rogers and starring Basil Sydney, Patricia Hilliard and Stewart Rome.BFI.org The screenplay involves a leading surgeon who murders his wife's lover.
* Stewart Rome - Sir John Barnes

The Ware Case is a 1928 British silent drama film directed by H. Manning Haynes and starring Stewart Rome, Betty Carter and  Ian Fleming.BFI.org The film was shot at the Twickenham Studios in London with sets designed by the art director Hugh Gee. It was an adaptation of the play The Ware Case by George Pleydell Bancroft, previously filmed in 1917, with another version appearing in 1938. First National (through Warner Bros.) distributed the film in the United States.
* Stewart Rome as Sir Hubert Ware
